Matsya (Sanskrit: , lit. fish) is the avatar of the Hindu god Vishnu in the 
form of a fish. Often listed as the first avatar in the lists of the ten primary avatars 
of Vishnu, Matsya is described to have rescued the first man, Manu, from a great 
deluge. Matsya may be depicted as a giant fish, or anthropomorphically with a ...
